doc.after: Maple syrup and maple sugar were used during the American Civil War and by abolitionists in the years prior to the war because most cane sugar and molasses were produced by Southern slaves 87 88 Because of food rationing during the Second World War people in the northeastern United States were encouraged to stretch their sugar rations by sweetening foods with maple syrup and maple sugar 15 and recipe books were printed to help housewives employ this alternative source 89
